# Content component and docs refactor (2025-12-24 19:50Z)

_**User (2025-12-24 19:03Z)**_

@.cursor/rules/hip-component.mdc We're going to create a new Component called "Content"

It should:

- @apps/docs/src/routes/docs.$.tsx adapt the styles from the content primitives (h1, h2, lists, etc) into a Wrapper that applies those styles
- should only need changes in the new component
- then refactor the docs.$ files to use that instead of applying its own

---

```diff
+ "use client";
+
+ import type { MDXComponents } from "mdx/types";
+
+ import * as stylex from "@stylexjs/stylex";
+ import { LinkIcon } from "lucide-react";
+ import {
+   createContext,
+   use,
+   useEffect,
+   useRef,
+   useState,
+ } from "react";
+
+ import { Flex } from "../flex";
+ import {
+   Blockquote,
+   BlockquoteProps,
+   Body,
+   Heading1,
+   Heading2,
+   Heading3,
+   Heading4,
+   Heading5,
+   InlineCode,
+   ListItem,
+   OrderedList,
+   UnorderedList,
+ } from "../typography";
+ import { animationDuration } from "../theme/animations.stylex";
+ import { radius } from "../theme/radius.stylex";
+ import { uiColor } from "../theme/color.stylex";
+ import { spacing } from "../theme/spacing.stylex";
+ import { lineHeight } from "../theme/typography.stylex";
+ import { StyleXComponentProps } from "../theme/types";
+
+ const styles = stylex.create({
+   pre: {
+     borderColor: uiColor.border2,
+     borderRadius: {
+       default: radius["lg"],
+       "@supports (corner-shape: squircle)": radius["4xl"],
+     },
+     cornerShape: "squircle",
+     borderStyle: "solid",
+     borderWidth: 1,
+     marginBottom: spacing["8"],
+     marginTop: spacing["8"],
+     padding: spacing["4"],
+     position: "relative",
+   },
+   copyButton: {
+     position: "absolute",
+     right: spacing["3"],
+     top: spacing["2.5"],
+   },
+   h1: {
+     marginBottom: spacing["8"],
+     marginTop: spacing["8"],
+   },
+   h2: {
+     marginBottom: spacing["4"],
+     marginTop: spacing["8"],
+   },
+   h3: {
+     marginBottom: spacing["5"],
+     marginTop: spacing["8"],
+   },
+   h4: {
+     marginBottom: spacing["8"],
+     marginTop: spacing["8"],
+   },
+   h5: {
+     marginBottom: spacing["8"],
+     marginTop: spacing["8"],
+   },
+   p: {
+     lineHeight: {
+       default: lineHeight.xl,
+       ":is(li *)": lineHeight.base,
+       ":is(blockquote *)": lineHeight.base,
+     },
+     marginBottom: {
+       default: spacing["5"],
+       ":is(li *)": spacing["0"],
+       ":is(blockquote *)": spacing["0"],
+     },
+     marginTop: {
+       default: spacing["5"],
+       ":is(li *)": spacing["0"],
+       ":is(blockquote *)": spacing["0"],
+     },
+   },
+   blockquote: {
+     marginBottom: 0,
+     marginLeft: spacing["2"],
+     marginRight: 0,
+     marginTop: 0,
+     paddingLeft: spacing["4"],
+   },
+   linkedHeadingLink: {
+     color: "inherit",
+     textDecoration: "none",
+   },
+   linkedHeadingLinkButton: {
+     opacity: {
+       default: 0,
+       ":is([data-heading-link]:hover *)": 1,
+       ":is([data-focus-visible])": 1,
+     },
+     transitionDuration: animationDuration.fast,
+     transitionProperty: {
+       default: "opacity",
+       "@media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce)": "none",
+     },
+     transitionTimingFunction: "ease-in-out",
+   },
+ });
+
+ const PreContext = createContext(false);
+
+ export interface ContentComponentsOptions {
+   /**
+    * Custom render function for the copy button in code blocks.
+    * Receives the text content and should return a React element.
+    */
+   renderCopyButton?: (text: string, style?: stylex.StyleXStyles) =&gt; React.ReactNode;
+   /**
+    * Custom render function for heading links.
+    * Receives the heading ID and should return a URL string.
+    */
+   getHeadingUrl?: (id: string) =&gt; string;
+   /**
+    * Custom render function for links.
+    * Receives href and props, should return a React element.
+    */
+   renderLink?: (
+     href: string | undefined,
+     props: React.ComponentProps&lt;"a"&gt;,
+   ) =&gt; React.ReactNode;
+ }
+
+ function Pre({
+   children,
+   renderCopyButton,
+   ...props
+ }: React.ComponentProps&lt;"pre"&gt; &amp; {
+   renderCopyButton?: (text: string, style?: stylex.StyleXStyles) =&gt; React.ReactNode;
+ }) {
+   const [textContent, setTextContent] = useState("error");
+   const ref = useRef&lt;HTMLPreElement&gt;(null);
+
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     // eslint-disable-next-line @eslint-react/hooks-extra/no-direct-set-state-in-use-effect, react-hooks/set-state-in-effect
+     setTextContent(ref.current?.textContent ?? "error");
+   }, [ref]);
+
+   return (
+     &lt;PreContext value={true}&gt;
+       &lt;pre
+         ref={ref}
+         {...props}
+         {...stylex.props(styles.pre)}
+         data-testid="code"
+       &gt;
+         {children}
+         {renderCopyButton &amp;&amp; renderCopyButton(textContent, styles.copyButton)}
+       &lt;/pre&gt;
+     &lt;/PreContext&gt;
+   );
+ }
+
+ function Code({ className, style, ...props }: React.ComponentProps&lt;"code"&gt;) {
+   const isPre = use(PreContext);
+
+   if (isPre) {
+     return &lt;code {...props} className={className} style={style} /&gt;;
+   }
+
+   return &lt;InlineCode {...props} /&gt;;
+ }
+
+ function DocsBlockquote(props: BlockquoteProps) {
+   return &lt;Blockquote {...props} style={styles.blockquote} /&gt;;
+ }
+
+ function LinkedHeading({
+   id,
+   children,
+   style,
+   getHeadingUrl,
+   renderCopyButton,
+ }: {
+   id?: string;
+   children: React.ReactNode;
+   style?: stylex.StyleXStyles;
+   getHeadingUrl?: (id: string) =&gt; string;
+   renderCopyButton?: (text: string, icon?: React.ReactNode, style?: stylex.StyleXStyles) =&gt; React.ReactNode;
+ }) {
+   if (!id) {
+     return &lt;&gt;{children}&lt;/&gt;;
+   }
+
+   const headingUrl = getHeadingUrl ? getHeadingUrl(id) : &#96;#${id}&#96;;
+
+   return (
+     &lt;Flex
+       direction="row"
+       gap="2"
+       align="center"
+       data-heading-link={true}
+       style={[style]}
+     &gt;
+       &lt;a href={headingUrl} {...stylex.props(styles.linkedHeadingLink)}&gt;
+         {children}
+       &lt;/a&gt;
+       {renderCopyButton &amp;&amp; renderCopyButton(
+         headingUrl,
+         &lt;LinkIcon /&gt;,
+         styles.linkedHeadingLinkButton,
+       )}
+     &lt;/Flex&gt;
+   );
+ }
+
+ /**
+  * Creates MDX components with content styling applied.
+  *
+  * @param options - Optional configuration for customizing component behavior
+  * @returns MDXComponents object that can be passed to MDX content
+  *
+  * @example
+  * &#96;&#96;&#96;tsx
+  * import { getContentComponents } from '@hip-ui/content';
+  *
+  * const components = getContentComponents({
+  *   renderLink: (href, props) =&gt; &lt;CustomLink href={href} {...props} /&gt;,
+  * });
+  *
+  * &lt;MDXContent components={components} /&gt;
+  * &#96;&#96;&#96;
+  */
+ export function getContentComponents(
+   options: ContentComponentsOptions = {},
+ ): MDXComponents {
+   const { renderCopyButton, getHeadingUrl, renderLink } = options;
+
+   return {
+     pre: ({ className: _className, style: _style, ...props }) =&gt; (
+       &lt;Pre {...props} renderCopyButton={renderCopyButton} /&gt;
+     ),
+     h1: ({ className: _className, style: _style, ...props }) =&gt; (
+       &lt;Heading1 {...props} style={styles.h1} /&gt;
+     ),
+     h2: ({ className: _className, style: _style, ...props }) =&gt; (
+       &lt;LinkedHeading
+         id={props.id}
+         style={styles.h2}
+         getHeadingUrl={getHeadingUrl}
+         renderCopyButton={renderCopyButton}
+       &gt;
+         &lt;Heading2 {...props} /&gt;
+       &lt;/LinkedHeading&gt;
+     ),
+     h3: ({ className: _className, style: _style, ...props }) =&gt; (
+       &lt;LinkedHeading
+         id={props.id}
+         style={styles.h3}
+         getHeadingUrl={getHeadingUrl}
+         renderCopyButton={renderCopyButton}
+       &gt;
+         &lt;Heading3 {...props} /&gt;
+       &lt;/LinkedHeading&gt;
+     ),
+     h4: ({ className: _className, style: _style, ...props }) =&gt; (
+       &lt;LinkedHeading
+         id={props.id}
+         style={styles.h4}
+         getHeadingUrl={getHeadingUrl}
+         renderCopyButton={renderCopyButton}
+       &gt;
+         &lt;Heading4 {...props} /&gt;
+       &lt;/LinkedHeading&gt;
+     ),
+     h5: ({ className: _className, style: _style, ...props }) =&gt; (
+       &lt;LinkedHeading
+         id={props.id}
+         style={styles.h5}
+         getHeadingUrl={getHeadingUrl}
+         renderCopyButton={renderCopyButton}
+       &gt;
+         &lt;Heading5 {...props} /&gt;
+       &lt;/LinkedHeading&gt;
+     ),
+     p: ({ className: _className, style: _style, ...props }) =&gt; (
+       &lt;Body {...props} style={styles.p} /&gt;
+     ),
+     a: ({ className: _className, style: _style, href, ...props }) =&gt; {
+       if (renderLink) {
+         return &lt;&gt;{renderLink(href, props)}&lt;/&gt;;
+       }
+       return &lt;a href={href} {...props} /&gt;;
+     },
+     ul: ({ className: _className, style: _style, ...props }) =&gt; (
+       &lt;UnorderedList {...props} /&gt;
+     ),
+     ol: ({ className: _className, style: _style, ...props }) =&gt; (
+       &lt;OrderedList {...props} /&gt;
+     ),
+     li: ({ className: _className, style: _style, ...props }) =&gt; (
+       &lt;ListItem {...props} /&gt;
+     ),
+     code: Code,
+     blockquote: ({ className: _className, style: _style, ...props }) =&gt; (
+       &lt;DocsBlockquote {...props} /&gt;
+     ),
+   };
+ }
+
```

```diff
+         renderCopyButton: (text, iconOrStyle, style) =&gt; {
+           // For code blocks: iconOrStyle is the style, style is undefined
+           // For headings: iconOrStyle is the icon, style is the style
+           if (style !== undefined) {
+             // Heading case: iconOrStyle is icon, style is style

+                 style={style as stylex.StyleXStyles}

+               /&gt;
+             );
+           }
+           // Code block case: iconOrStyle is style
+           return (
+             &lt;CopyToClipboardButton
+               style={iconOrStyle as stylex.StyleXStyles}
+               text={text}
+             /&gt;
```

---

## Summary

1. **Created Content component** (`packages/hip-ui/src/components/content/index.tsx`):
   - Extracted MDX component styles from `docs.$.tsx`
   - Provides `getContentComponents()` that returns styled MDX components
   - Accepts optional customization props:
     - `renderCopyButton` for code blocks and headings
     - `getHeadingUrl` for heading link URLs
     - `renderLink` for custom link rendering

2. **Created config file** (`content-config.ts`):
   - Lists dependencies (theme files, flex, typography)
   - Registered in `install.tsx` COMPONENT_CONFIGS array

3. **Refactored `docs.$.tsx`**:
   - Removed styles and component logic now in Content
   - Uses `getContentComponents()` with docs-specific customizations:
     - Router link handling for internal links
     - Copy button with icons for headings
     - Full URL generation for heading links
   - Kept only route-specific styles (root, main, header)

The Content component is reusable, and all content styling is centralized. The docs route now uses the component with its customizations.

```diff
+     &lt;/LinkedHeading&gt;
+   ),
+   p: ({ className: _className, style: _style, ...props }) =&gt; (
+     &lt;Body {...props} /&gt;
+   ),
+   a: ({ className: _className, style: _style, ...props }) =&gt; (
+     &lt;Link {...(props as LinkProps)} /&gt;
+   ),
+   ul: ({ className: _className, style: _style, ...props }) =&gt; (
+     &lt;UnorderedList {...props} /&gt;
+   ),
+   ol: ({ className: _className, style: _style, ...props }) =&gt; (
+     &lt;OrderedList {...props} /&gt;
+   ),
+   li: ({ className: _className, style: _style, ...props }) =&gt; (
+     &lt;ListItem {...props} /&gt;
+   ),
+   code: Code,
+   blockquote: ({ className: _className, style: _style, ...props }) =&gt; (
+     &lt;DocsBlockquote {...props} /&gt;
+   ),
+ };

  export const Route = createFileRoute("/docs/$")({
```

</details>

</tool-use>

```diff
+ title: Content
+ description: A wrapper component that applies consistent spacing styles to content elements.

+ import { PropDocs } from '../../../lib/PropDocs'
+ import { Example } from '../../../lib/Example'
+ import { Basic } from '../../../examples/content/basic'
+ import { WithLists } from '../../../examples/content/with-lists'

+
+ ## Installation
+
+ Run the following command to add the content component to your project.
+
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ pnpm hip install content
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+
+ ## Props
+
+ &lt;PropDocs components={["Content"]} /&gt;
+
+ ## Features
+
+ ### Automatic Spacing
+
+ The Content component automatically applies consistent margins to child elements:
+
+ - **Headings (h1-h5)**: Top and bottom margins for proper vertical rhythm
+ - **Paragraphs**: Spacing between paragraphs, with adjusted spacing when nested in lists or blockquotes
+ - **Blockquotes**: Left border, padding, and zero margins for proper indentation
+ - **Lists**: Proper spacing maintained for list items
+
+ ### With Lists
+
+ The Content component handles spacing for both ordered and unordered lists:
+
+ &lt;Example src={WithLists} /&gt;
+
+ ### With Blockquotes
+
+ Blockquotes receive special styling with proper indentation and spacing:
+
+ &lt;Example src={WithBlockquote} /&gt;
+
+ ### Comprehensive Example
+
+ See all content elements working together with consistent spacing:
+
+ &lt;Example src={Comprehensive} /&gt;
+
+ ## Related Components
+
+ - [Typography](/docs/components/content/typography) - For semantic typography components
+ - [Text](/docs/components/content/text) - For flexible text styling
+ - [Card](/docs/components/content/card) - For grouping content in containers
+
```

## Summary

Created documentation and examples for the Content component:

1. **Documentation** (`apps/docs/src/docs/components/content/content.mdx`):
   - Installation instructions
   - Props documentation
   - Feature descriptions
   - Multiple examples

   - `with-blockquote.tsx` - Shows blockquote styling

---

Updated all examples to use system typography components instead of raw HTML elements:

- `Heading1`, `Heading2`, `Heading3`, `Heading4`, `Heading5` instead of `h1`–`h5`
- `Body` instead of `p`
- `Blockquote` instead of `blockquote`
- `UnorderedList` and `OrderedList` instead of `ul` and `ol`
- `ListItem` instead of `li`

All examples now use the system components, and the linter shows no errors. The Content component will still apply spacing styles to these components since they render as the corresponding HTML elements.
